attributes.action: Defer IR35 legislation for at least 1 year.
attributes.additional_details:
The coronavirus is currently fatal to less than 1% of humans, but will be fatal to 20% of British businesses, many will not survive this. 

There will be hardships on families, loss of homes, financial instability and an increase in mental health issues (Anxiety & stress). 

IR35 if implemented this year, will have a detrimental effect to the sustainability and well being of British businesses, the national interest and its citizens. #IR35lifeline #savebritishbusiness
attributes.background: With a number of business under increasing pressure, facing financial difficulties and potential bankruptcy due to impacts from the coronavirus, should the UK government postpone IR35 for another year?

rejection.details:
Since you started this petition, the Government has announced that these reforms have been postponed until 2021. You can read more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/off-payroll-working-rules-reforms-postponed-until-2021

You may be interested in signing this petition, calling on the Government to revoke IR35 legislation: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300458

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus
